titleStmt.title: Dispatch from E. Headley Bailey and M. S. Alexander to Thomas B. Florence, January 31, 1859

bibl.title: Dispatch from E. Headley Bailey and M. S. Alexander to Thomas B. Florence, January 31, 1859
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.ab:
To the Thomas B. Florence
H.R.
div1.p: We have instructed to and several copies of Certificate, also an Original petition from Ship masters for the appointment of John E. Taylor as consul at Sierra Leone on the Coast of Africa, Mr. Taylor was appointed by Commodore, Mayo commander of the United States Squadron in the year as you will perceive by enclosed Copies of Certificate, to you, object in writing in to have the appointment of John E. Taylor, by Commadore Mayo, confirmed by the President of the United States, and by the Senate if neccessary or in any manner that is legal and right to have the said appointment confirmed, your attention to this will place us under another obligation to you were we already owe you so much, your valuable time is taken up but still take the liberty of addressing you on this subject.
div1.ab:
Very Respectfully,
Mrs. Bailey & Alexander
No 402 Library Street
enclosed we requested to take great of all three and no Copies

Respectfully request
to the consideration
of the Secretary
of State,
by
Thomas B. Florence
H of R
